FESTIVAL EVENT ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM FOR NATIVE HAWAIIAN CULTURAL PRACTITIONERS AND VISITORS
K? IE IE FISHPOND S VISITOR ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM
NANA I KE KUMU  LOOK TO THE SOURCE
I MANA KA 'AINA VISITOR ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM  THE RECOUNTING OF THE HISTORY OF UHAU'IOLE AND THE LARGER WAILUA AHUPUA'A THROUGH THE VOICES OF THE LAND AND OUR ANCESTORS

THROUGH ITS SIGNATURE 46TH ANNUAL PRINCE LOT HULA FESTIVAL, MOANALUA GARDENS FOUNDATION, A NATIVE HAWAIIAN ORGANIZATION, STRIVES TO EMPOWER THE NATIVE HAWAIIAN COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING A PLATFORM TO AUTHENTICALLY SHARE THE ART OF HULA AND HAWAI I S HOST CULTURE WITH LOCAL AND NATIONAL AUDIENCES  THE PROJECT S LONG TERM, OVERARCHING GOAL IS TO AUTHENTICALLY PERPETUATE MO OMEHEU  NATIVE HAWAIIAN CULTURE , MO OLELO  FOLKLORE , MELE  SONG , OLI  CHANT ,  ?LELO HAWAI I  HAWAIIAN LANGUAGE , AND TRADITIONS OF THE INDIGENOUS PEOPLE OF HAWAI I FOR THE PAST 45 YEARS, THE FESTIVAL HAS PROVIDED A MULTITUDE OF OPPORTUNITIES FOR KANAKA MAOLI  NATIVE HAWAIIANS  AND HALAU HULA  HULA SCHOOLS  TO SHARE CULTURAL TRADITIONS AND PERFORMANCES IN HAWAI I S LARGEST NON COMPETITIVE HULA CELEBRATION  CONTINUING THE PRESERVATION OF ONE OF THE PUREST FORMS OF HAWAIIAN ARTISTIC EXPRESSION, WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY BUILDING PERSONAL PRIDE AND RESPECT IN HAUMANA  STUDENTS  FOR HAWAI I S HOST CULTURE THE CENTERPIECE OF THE HULA FESTIVAL WILL BE THE 14 NEW AND RETURNING HALAU HULA THROUGHOUT HAWAI I WHO WILL BE INVITED TO PERFORM ON A REGAL STAGE FRONTING  IOLANI PALACE  KUMU HULA  HULA TEACHERS  WITH OVERSEAS BRANCHES ARE ENCOURAGED TO INVITE OUT OF STATE STUDENTS TO PERFORM  THE 2023 FESTIVAL WILL PIONEER AN INNOVATIVE FORMAT COMBINING THE EXCITEMENT OF A LIVE IN PERSON EVENT FEATURING KAHIKO  ANCIENT  AND  AUANA  MODERN  HULA PERFORMANCES, CULTURAL DEMONSTRATIONS, FOOD TRUCKS, A CRAFT FAIR, AND A VIRTUAL EVENT    AN INSPIRATIONAL TWO HOUR TELEVISION PROGRAM TO BE AIRED IN SEPTEMBER 2023  THIS UNIQUE CONCEPT PROVIDES A VENUE FOR OUR KAMA AINA AND VISITORS TO GATHER AS WELL AS REACH TENS OF THOUSANDS MORE WORLDWIDE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE KANAKA MAOLI LIVING HERE IN HAWAI I AND ABROAD, VISITORS FROM SUCH MAJOR MARKET MARKET AREAS AS NORTH AMERICA, ASIA AND EUROPE, AS WELL AS AN EXPONENTIAL NUMBER OF KANAKA MAOLI, INDIGENOUS COMMUNITIES, AND VISITORS WORLDWIDE THE LIVE FESTIVAL S EXPECTED AUDIENCE IS 5,000 AND THE VIRTUAL FESTIVAL S AUDIENCE IS ESTIMATED AT OVER 200,000 ON LOCAL TELEVISION, ANOTHER 10,000 VIA LIVE STREAM, AND 50,000 ON SOCIAL MEDIA
